channel.title: 纽约时报-全球
channel.description: 这是一个追踪纽约时报-全球news的种子

item.title: 在全球变暖的时代，如何举办一场全球体育盛会，让数以百万计的人俯冲到一个城市？
item.description:
How do you produce a global sporting event, with millions of people swooping down on one city, in the age of global warming?

That is the test for the Paris Olympics this summer. https://t.co/L6VKpqLPjO

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 17, 2024

item.title: 谁把蛇放出来的？气候变化。由于爬行动物的冬眠期--冬眠期正在缩短，蛇与人类的遭遇正在增加。
item.description:
Who let the snakes out? Climate change. Encounters between snakes and humans are increasing, as the period of brumation, a sort of hibernation for reptiles, is shrinking. https://t.co/hAilNonwjc

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 17, 2024

item.title: 周日，当第二艘拖着急需的援助物资的船只准备驶往加沙时，运送这些船只的食品慈善机构创始人何塞-安德烈斯呼吁停火，并表示以色列应采取更多措施来防止加沙出现饥饿现象。
item.description:
As a second ship towing desperately needed aid prepared to depart for Gaza on Sunday, José Andrés, the founder of the food charity sending the vessels, called for a cease-fire and said that Israel should be doing more to prevent hunger in Gaza. https://t.co/MNI7ELjzkb

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 17, 2024

item.title: 反对党领袖阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼的遗孀尤利娅-纳瓦尔娜娅周日在俄罗斯驻柏林大使馆外与选民一起排队，这是她自丈夫上个月去世后为数不多的公开露面之一。
item.description:
Yulia Navalnaya, the widow of the opposition leader Aleksei A. Navalny, lined up with voters outside the Russian embassy in Berlin on Sunday, in one of her few public appearances since her husband’s death last month. https://t.co/faAargulbP

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 17, 2024

item.title: 肯特-坎贝尔（Kent Campbell）是全球抗击疟疾的重要人物，尤其是在非洲，他领导了一项提供蚊帐的创新计划，保护农村村民免受携带疟疾的蚊子的侵害。
item.description:
Kent Campbell, an instrumental figure in the global battle against malaria — most notably in Africa, where he led an innovative program providing bed nets to protect rural villagers from the mosquitoes that carry the disease — has died at 80. https://t.co/m9ndkzs9Tl

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 17, 2024

item.title: 虽然弗拉基米尔-普京总统尽量减少竞选活动，不参加辩论和集会，但他在克里姆林宫控制的俄罗斯电视台上却无处不在。
item.description:
While President Vladimir V. Putin kept election campaigning to a minimum, skipping debates and rallies, he’s been omnipresent on Russian television, where Kremlin-controlled outlets dominate. https://t.co/X93mJgRpLS

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 17, 2024

item.title: 多年来，加拿大和世界各地的地方新闻机构一直麻烦不断。但现在，一家贷款人要求哈利法克斯法院解散这两家公司，因为它们共同拥有新不伦瑞克省以外的加拿大大西洋地区的大部分报纸。
item.description:
Local news outlets have been in trouble in Canada and around the world for years. But now a lender has asked a Halifax court to dissolve the two companies that jointly own most of the newspapers in Atlantic Canada outside New Brunswick. https://t.co/jI4gNV7UUJ

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 17, 2024

item.title: 海地首都遭到黑帮袭击，本已薄弱的医疗系统变得支离破碎。由于暴力事件，许多医院关闭或无法满负荷运转。
item.description:
A gang assault on Haiti’s capital has left an already weak health care system in tatters. Many hospitals there are closed or unable to open at full capacity because of the violence. https://t.co/XMxYnLcUqT

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 17, 2024

item.title: 在全球变暖的时代，如何举办一场全球体育盛会，让数以百万计的人俯冲到一个城市？
item.description:
How do you produce a global sporting event, with millions of people swooping down on one city, in the age of global warming?

That is the test for the Paris Olympics this summer. https://t.co/wUJxnnF4RI

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 17, 2024

item.title: 星期六晚上，冰岛南部的一座火山在没有任何通知的情况下爆发了，这是该地区一系列火山爆发中的最新一次，威胁到当地的基础设施，导致当局宣布进入紧急状态。
item.description:
A volcano erupted with little notice in southern Iceland on Saturday night, the latest in a string of eruptions in the area, threatening local infrastructure and leading the authorities to declare a state of emergency. https://t.co/reqaNSpqYl

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 17, 2024

item.title: 本雅明-内塔尼亚胡总理周日直接回应了参议员查克-舒默，称这位参议院多数党领袖最近对以色列领导人的批评以及要求在以色列举行选举的呼吁 "完全不恰当"。
item.description:
Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu responded directly to Senator Chuck Schumer on Sunday, calling the Senate majority leader’s recent criticism of the Israeli leader and call for elections there “totally inappropriate.”. https://t.co/J4L3E17DBP

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 17, 2024

item.title: 虽然俄罗斯大选的结果毋庸置疑，但一些人担心，普京总统的胆大妄为可能会为乌克兰战争发起新一轮动员，或者经济可能会受到打击。
item.description:
While the outcome of Russia’s election is in little doubt, some fear that an emboldened President Vladimir Putin may launch a new mobilization for the war in Ukraine, or that the economy might take a hit. https://t.co/7S23DdKUg1

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 17, 2024

item.title: 联合国人权办公室记录了自 1 月以来对等待急需援助的加沙人的二十多次袭击。
item.description:
The United Nations human rights office has documented more than two dozen attacks on Gazans waiting for desperately needed aid since January. https://t.co/ReZF5VxaVE

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 17, 2024

item.title: 周六，近二十年来第一批通过海路运抵加沙的援助物资在地中海的一个临时码头上全部卸载，这标志着西方官员希望缓解该飞地日益恶化的粮食匮乏状况的冒险行动中的一个里程碑。
item.description:
The first shipment of aid to reach Gaza by sea in almost two decades was fully unloaded on Saturday on a makeshift jetty in the Mediterranean, marking a milestone in a venture that Western officials hope will ease the enclave’s worsening food deprivation. https://t.co/M4P8K7WQnw

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 17, 2024

item.title: 海地首都遭到黑帮袭击，本已薄弱的医疗系统变得支离破碎。由于暴力事件，许多医院关闭或无法满负荷运转。
item.description:
A gang assault on Haiti’s capital has left an already weak health care system in tatters. Many hospitals there are closed or unable to open at full capacity because of the violence. https://t.co/noDNpGj1ry

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 17, 2024

item.title: 在总统选举投票的最后一天，俄罗斯的许多人似乎都在响应反对派的号召，在中午时分集体到场表达不满。"一位妇女说："我们别无选择。
item.description:
On the last day of the presidential vote, many in Russia appeared to be heeding a call by the opposition to express frustration by showing up en masse at midday. “We don’t have any other options,” said one woman. https://t.co/Obd1XJQ0cg

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 17, 2024

A volcano erupted with little notice in southern Iceland on Saturday night, the latest in a string of eruptions in the area, threatening local infrastructure and leading the authorities to declare a state of emergency. https://t.co/leQ2ylVbAa

item.title: 虽然俄罗斯总统大选的结果毋庸置疑，但人们担心，胆大妄为的弗拉基米尔-普京总统可能会利用大选的胜利开始新一轮的战争动员。
item.description:
While there is little doubt about the outcome of the presidential vote in Russia, there is concern that an emboldened President Vladimir Putin may use a win to start a new war mobilization. https://t.co/M3XPbldeq7

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 17, 2024

item.title: 本周末，一批海运援助物资抵达加沙海岸，这是近二十年来的首次。但专家们表示，增加新的援助运送方式不太可能缓解飞地的饥饿危机。
item.description:
This weekend, a maritime shipment of aid reached Gaza’s shores, the first to do so in nearly two decades. But experts said that adding new methods of aid delivery was unlikely to ease the hunger crisis in the enclave. https://t.co/bGMbUkJ210

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 17, 2024

item.title: 在对弗拉基米尔-普京总统政府的仇恨驱使下，与乌克兰结盟的俄罗斯流亡组织正试图渗透俄罗斯的第一道防线，以便另一支部队能将坦克和装甲运兵车开进俄罗斯更深处。
item.description:
Driven by hatred for the government of President Vladimir Putin, Russian exile groups allied with Ukraine are trying to penetrate a first Russian defensive line so another unit can drive tanks and armored personnel carriers deeper into Russia. https://t.co/7cf2oFtTuc

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 16, 2024

item.title: 多年来，加拿大和世界各地的地方新闻机构一直麻烦不断。但现在，一家贷款人要求哈利法克斯法院解散这两家公司，因为它们共同拥有新不伦瑞克省以外的加拿大大西洋地区的大部分报纸。
item.description:
Local news outlets have been in trouble in Canada and around the world for years. But now a lender has asked a Halifax court to dissolve the two companies that jointly own most of the newspapers in Atlantic Canada outside New Brunswick. https://t.co/fczOAnw4St

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 16, 2024

item.title: 以色列在加沙发动的战争使周一开始的斋月从一个色彩斑斓、人声鼎沸的集会变成了一个在灰色瓦砾和黑暗空荡的街道背景下进行的斋月。
item.description:
Israel’s war in Gaza has transformed Ramadan, which began on Monday, from one of color and boisterous gatherings into one observed against a backdrop of gray rubble and dark, empty streets. https://t.co/xDNi8pg32I

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 16, 2024

item.title: 六年前，澳大利亚通过了范围广泛的外国干涉法，因为人们越来越担心中国政府会暗中干涉西方民主国家。现在，首起审判案件引发了人们对该法规广度的质疑。
item.description:
Australia’s broad-stroke foreign interference laws were passed six years ago amid rising concerns about covert Chinese government meddling in Western democracies. Now, the first case on trial has raised questions about the breadth of the regulations. https://t.co/kQ1ZABS2q2

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 16, 2024

item.title: 菲律宾总统小费迪南德-马科斯（Ferdinand R. Marcos Jr.
item.description:
With China aggressively asserting its claims on the South China Sea, President Ferdinand R. Marcos Jr. of the Philippines says escalating tensions are not only a regional issue, but a global one. https://t.co/S18qiPdyxl

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 16, 2024

item.title: "在澳大利亚阳光海岸，遇到蛇的情况越来越常见，当我想写一篇关于捕蛇人的文章时，不知怎么就忘了，报道蛇类需要花很多时间与它们相处"。
item.description:
“When I pitched an article about snake catchers on Australia’s Sunshine Coast, where snake encounters are becoming increasingly common, I had somehow forgotten that reporting on snakes would require spending quite a bit of time with them.” https://t.co/gYJcBjRDom

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 16, 2024

item.title: 一位政治分析家说，在乌克兰被占领土举行橡皮图章式的选举，会把这些地区编织进俄罗斯的国家结构中。
item.description:
Holding rubber-stamp elections in occupied territories in Ukraine has the effect, one political analyst said, of weaving these regions into the fabric of Russian statehood. https://t.co/Pq9COuBRtd

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 16, 2024

item.title: 印度宣布将于 4 月 19 日至 6 月 1 日举行多阶段大选，这次投票将决定这个世界上人口最多的国家未来五年的政治走向。
item.description:
India announced that it is holding its multiphase general elections from April 19 to June 1, a vote that will determine the political direction of the world’s most populous nation for the next five years. https://t.co/DANmMMJrON

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 16, 2024

item.title: 据伊朗和美国官员称，伊朗和美国于 1 月在阿曼举行了秘密会谈，讨论也门胡塞武装对红海航运构成的威胁升级以及伊朗支持的民兵在伊拉克袭击美国基地的问题。
item.description:
Iran and the U.S. held secret talks in Oman in January, addressing the escalating threat posed to Red Sea shipping by the Houthis in Yemen, as well as the attacks on American bases by Iran-backed militias in Iraq, according to Iranian and U.S. officials. https://t.co/WewXZ0w64d

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 16, 2024

item.title: 塞尔日-拉乌尔（Serge Raoul）创办了曼哈顿下城的拉乌尔餐厅（Raoul's），在上世纪七八十年代，这家餐厅吸引了众多名人，成为附近居民的家常便饭。但作为一名电影制片人，他从未想过要在餐饮业度过一生。他已经去世，享年 86 岁。
item.description:
Serge Raoul founded the Lower Manhattan restaurant Raoul’s, which became a celebrity magnet and a neighborhood institution in the ’70s and ’80s. But as a filmmaker, he had never planned on a life in the restaurant business. He has died at 86. https://t.co/q8Uv22WC6y

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 16, 2024
